hello markus.

On 2012-03-06 08:23 , Markus Lanthaler wrote:
> A link relation's value doesn't have to be an IRI (in fact most of them
> aren't) whereas the value of "profile" always has to be an IRI.

i am a little bit confused by what you're saying.

- a *link relation type value* either is a registered name (which is 
what i am trying to do for 'profile'), or it has to be a URI, at least 
this is what RFC 5988 defines. http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4

- the *target of any link* has to be a URI or IRI, based on the context 
of where the link appears. there is nothing any link relation type can 
change about this, this is how links work on the web.

could you please clarify what you mean by the above statement?

thanks and cheers,

dret.
